sources.title: On With the Show (1929) SALLY O'NEIL üçïBETTY COMPSON üçïBACKSTAGE MUSICAL
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Stars: Sally O'Neil, William Bakewell, Betty Compson, Joe E. Brown, AND Ethel Waters
Director: Alan Crosland
üçïFEATURED MUSICAL HIGHLIGHTSüçï
13:55          "Welcome Home" Henry Fink 
19:06          "Let Me Have My Dreams" Betty Compson
23:06          "Am I Blue?" Ethel Waters and the Harmony Four Quartette
30:29          "Lift the Juleps to Your Two Lips" Henry Fink
49:04          "In the Land of Let's Pretend" Mildred Carroll 
00:58:02    "Don't It Mean a Thing to You?"Mildred Carroll
01:31:13    "Birmingham Bertha" Ethel Waters, dancing by Angelus Babe
01:39:26    "Wedding Day" Sally O'Neil, Henry Fink, Arthur Lake, Josephine Huston

Experience a groundbreaking moment in film history with this 1929 musical milestone, directed by Alan Crosland‚Äîrenowned for his work on The Jazz Singer. Set backstage at a lively theatrical revue, the story mixes music, comedy, and romance with the chaos of show business.

The ensemble cast features Betty Compson, Sally O‚ÄôNeil, Arthur Lake, Louise Fazenda, and , each bringing charm and energy to their roles as performers, producers, and dreamers navigating life behind the curtain. 

Adding to the film‚Äôs legacy is a standout musical performance by legendary singer Ethel Waters in her silver screen debut with ‚ÄúAm I Blue?‚Äù and "Birmingham Bertha". Also featured is Angelus Babe, whose dynamic dance performance exemplifies the high-energy choreography that defined early movie musicals. 

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

With its backstage setting, dramatic rivalries, and show-stopping spectacle, the production captures the spirit of the Jazz Age and the excitement of early Hollywood musicals.

üé≠ Subscribe for more Oscar-winning films, vintage musicals, and Pre-Code Hollywood gems!

Known for its elaborate musical numbers, witty dialogue, and colorful visuals, the film offers an early glimpse of the movie musical formula that would dominate the 1930s.

#OnWithTheShow #Ethel Waters #Angelus Babe #BettyCompson #ArthurLake #LouiseFazenda #SallyONeil #AlanCrosland  #William Bakewell #1929Movies #PreCodeHollywood #EarlyTalkies #GoldenAgeHollywood #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: A musical advertised as the first 100% natural color, all-singing production. The plot concerns a wide-eyed former hatcheck girl who takes the place of a rebellious star.
metadata.Actors: Arthur Lake, Betty Compson, Joe E. Brown
